Meanwhile, in a secret facility, Captain Jane Hollister, leader of the Department of Scientific Intelligence (DSI), is monitoring thermal signatures caused by Charlie's outbursts. Andy is shown using his power, 'the push', to influence a client to stop smoking, although the strain causes his eyes to bleed.
On the road, they encounter a man named Irv Manders. After using the push to convince Irv to take them to Boston, they hitch a ride with him.
After Charlie accidentally stumbles upon his paralyzed wife, Irv flies into a rage before conceding that he occasionally overreacts.

node_2: film version of one of king's cheesier novels
edge: Frank Scheck of The Hollywood Reporter wrote that the film never achieves the deliriously freaky heights one expects from a film version of one of King's cheesier novels.
Benjamin Lee of The Guardian also gave it 1/5 stars, writing, 'No one here seems to know what they're doing and, more importantly, why. A strong contender for 2022's most pointless movie.'
While it has a few genuine scares... it never achieves the deliriously freaky heights one expects from a film version of one of King's cheesier novels.
